tweets.text:
Today, @TheFloodHub launches its Landscapes to Lifescapes exhibition. Put together by teams from @CUIDARProject, @eelatHull and @EnvAgency, the exhibition focuses on the the physical and social effects of flooding. View here: https://t.co/le93oGmuHO.

#Landscapes2Lifescapes. https://t.co/YrJSKVRtMq

The Environment Agency @EnvAgency together with @LancasterUni, @UniOfHull and @TheFloodHub have developed a brand new digital flood exhibition: Landscapes to Lifescapes #Landscapes2Lifescapes https://t.co/fEmBgnjghq

Head to @TheFloodHub to take part in a special exhibition called #Landscapes2Lifescapes which launches TODAY.
A team of researchers from @LancasterUni, @UniOfHull  and @EnvAgency are exploring how #flooding affects our physical and social environment #FloodAware https://t.co/6oRvFrCLJA

Work starts at #ThePortofTilbury on a major project with @EnvAgency to construct innovative #FloodDefence system. The new scheme will safeguard thousands of local homes & businesses. 

Read here: https://t.co/eYDJJTn98D

#TidalBarrier #FloodDefence @JacobsConnects @balfourbeatty

Launching today @ 11.30 from @floodandcoast our virtual exhibition with @FloodSkinner & @EnvAgency aimed at all ages: a resource 4 anyone wishing 2 learn about both the environmental & social consequences of #floods #Landscapes2Lifescape: www.thefloodhub/landscapes-to-lifescapes

Next up at #FloodandCoast is the community session - how do we build a digital flood and coast community hosted by @EnvAgency's Catherine Wright @MoretonBack1. Also, @CIWEM's Young Environmentalist of the Year Award winner revealed!

It‚Äôs just ONE DAY to go to the launch of the #Landscapes2Lifescapes exhibition. We can‚Äôt wait to share it with you! üì¢

#Landscapes2Lifescapes #UKEdChat #EdTeach #KS1 #KS2 #TeacherTuesday #FloodAware #SciComm #GeographyTeacher #FloodResilience #Floods https://t.co/uY2zd77AEK

We'll never forget hearing the stories of young people who were flooded from their homes. They wanted their accounts and experiences to make a difference, and they have! @TimSmithCEO @MagnaCartaSch @SociologyLancs @ESRC @johncurtinEA @JoCColes @EEIatHull @EnvAgency https://t.co/q6hj45i5qp

We are working extremely closely with the @EnvAgencySE @Kent_cc and @SouthernWater to tackle any problems that might come our way.

Full update: https://t.co/WmmGJa33p2 https://t.co/To6JzCRZyA

FLOOD ALERT UPDATE 5am 3/1/21.

@tinaonions @LeicsCountyHall @CharnwoodBC @LR4x4Response @benvolresponder @EnvAgencyMids @FloodDigitalEA @ATCLeicester https://t.co/sDS2FzkqyL

Surface water #flooding is possible in parts of northern and central England due to rain falling on saturated ground.

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water. 

For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority. 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/GUyF4cRfLT

@RossDunc @joypenzer @55motown @westrowhendo @saveferriby2020 @JuliaBradbury @ArroJoanne @friends_earth @energyestuary @EnvAgencyYNE @East_Riding @BadgerTrust @Humberbeat @HullRebellion @XR_BSE @BarnOwlTrust @ChrisGPackham @BBCSpringwatch @Wykeland @RSPCA_official Yep. Busy day yesterday dealing with this along with other amazing residents. Absolutely no need for this wanton destruction unless you want to destroy habitat before it can be properly surveyed of course...

urls.title: Social Ecological Dynamics of Catchment Resilience
urls.description: Catchment resilience is the capacity of a combined social ecological system, comprised of water, land, ecological resources and communities in a river basin, to deal with sudden shocks and gradual changes, and to adapt and self-organize for progressive change and transform itself for sustainability. This paper proposes that analysis of catchments as social ecological systems can provide key insights into how social and ecological dynamics interact and how some of the negative consequences of unsustainable resource use or environmental degradation can be ameliorated. This requires recognition of the potential for community resilience as a core element of catchment resilience, and moves beyond more structural approaches to emphasize social dynamics. The proposals are based on a review of social ecological systems research, on methods for analyzing community resilience, and a review of social science and action research that suggest ways of generating resilience through community engageme
